alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Dillon; Florence; Marion; Marlboro (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 5:03PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Florence, Dillon, Darlington, northwestern Marion and Marlboro Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 502 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms over Oats, or near Hartsville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Florence, Bennettsville, Hartsville, Dillon, Darlington, Timmonsville, Latta, Lamar, Quinby, Lake View, Clio, Sellers, Blue Brick, Hamer, Brownsville, Darlington Raceway, Swift Creek, Chavistown, Floyd and Minturn. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between mile markers 125 and 141. Interstate 95 in South Carolina between mile markers 146 and 196. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
